paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on two variants in the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data and functional effects.

patients.phenotype: altered fasting and glucose-stimulated plasma incretin and glucagon responses

individual_records.phenotype_details: increased GLP-1 and decreased GIP response to oral glucose stimulation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The minor A-allele of rs36210421 was associated with increased GLP-1 and decreased GIP response to oral glucose stimulation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: decreased fasting plasma insulin and glucagon release
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The minor G-allele of rs1805123 is associated with decreased fasting plasma insulin and glucagon release.

functional_data.summary: The minor A-allele of rs36210421 (R1047L) and the minor G-allele of rs1805123 (K897T) have gain-of-function effects on the hERG channel.

variants.segregation_data: The variants segregate with altered metabolic responses in the studied cohorts.
variants.population_frequency: MAF of 3.4% (A-allele) and 24% (G-allele) in ADDITION-PRO cohort; 3.1% and 22% in Inter99 cohort.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests that hERG potassium channels play a role in fasting and glucose-stimulated release of GIP and glucagon.
key_quotes: Carriers of either the minor A-allele of rs36210421 or the minor G-allele of rs1805123 had ~ 2 ms shorter QT interval per risk allele.
The minor A-allele of rs36210421 was associated with increased GLP-1 and decreased GIP response to oral glucose stimulation.

tables_processed.table_caption: Association of variants (rs36210421 and rs1805123) with QT interval and metabolic changes in INTER99 cohort (n = 5487)
Association of unweighted genetic risk score with metabolic and incretin levels in ADDITION-PRO cohort (N = 1324)

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
